page.title: 01Willoughton & Blyborough
page.content: The villages are located on the spring line west of limestone cliff, on ringe of trent valley. Tree-lined roads, deciduous trees including "willow". Little through traffic. Basically agriculture. Main crops wheat, Barley, Potatoes, Sugar Beet, Oilseed Rape. Cattle, Sheep. Racehorse training stables. Blood-horse breeding on outskirts an important influence. Most proety owned by estate companies who also own other large areas of land elsewhere. A few private houses for families who commute to Lincoln, Scunthorpe, Gainsborough. Family firm of Rose Growers. Private bus company mainly carrying school children. Secondary age range to Kirton Lindsey, primary age from surrounding area to village school. lmost every family owns at least one car. Two football fields
